query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Noi eravam lunghesso mare ancora, 11 come gente che pensa a suo cammino, 12 che va col cuore e col corpo dimora.
query.result:
**English:**
10 We were still walking along the seashore, 11 like people who are thinking about their journey, 12 who go forward in heart but linger in body.
**Cornish:**
10 Ni a veu hedrevek orth an mor, 11 kepar den a wra'n ow tos orth y'n fordh, 12 ow tos orth gans y'n colon ha'n korf ow tos ow tos.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 Ed ecco, qual, sorpreso dal mattino, 14 per li grossi vapor Marte rosseggia 15 giù nel ponente sovra ’l suol marino,
16 cotal m’apparve, s’io ancor lo veggia, 17 un lume per lo mar venir sì ratto, 18 che ’l muover suo nessun volar pareggia.
query.result:
**English:**
13 And behold, like Mars, surprised by the morning, 14 reddens through the thick vapors 15 down in the west over the sea floor,
16 so appeared to me, if I still see it, 17 a light coming across the sea so swiftly 18 that no flight can match its motion.
**Cornish:**
13 Ha'n rak, kepar, ow tos ow tos orth an myttyn, 14 orth an moylow tew, Marte ow tos ow tos ow tos, 15 orth an west orth an mor,
16 marow ow tos ow tos orth vy, pan ow'm ow tos ow tos ow tos, 17 golow orth an mor ow tos ow tos ow tos, 18 le mayth y'n fordh nyns ow tos ow tos ow tos.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 Dal qual com’ io un poco ebbi ritratto 20 l’occhio per domandar lo duca mio, 21 rividil più lucente e maggior fatto.
query.result:
**English:**
19 From which, when I had withdrawn my eyes for a moment 20 to ask my guide, 21 I saw it again, brighter and larger.
**Cornish:**
19 Orth an moylow ow tos ow tos ow tos, 20 ow'm a wrug vy lagha orth vy arlodh, 21 ow'm a'gas ow tos ow tos ow tos ha moy.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Poi d’ogne lato ad esso m’appario 23 un non sapeva che bianco, e di sotto 24 a poco a poco un altro a lui uscìo.
query.result:
**English:**
22 Then on each side of it appeared to me 23 one I did not know, who was white, and from below 24 little by little another one came out to him.**Cornish:**
22 Wosa henna onenydh dheuthughen 23 unnansavsa pyw gwyn, ha dhyworth 24 bys vyghan byghan unn aral dheuthughen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Lo mio maestro ancor non facea motto, 26 mentre che i primi bianchi apparver ali; 27 allor che ben conobbe il galeotto,
28 gridò: «Fa, fa che le ginocchia cali.
query.result:
**English:**
25 My master still did not speak a word, 26 while the first white ones appeared on the shore; 27 then when he recognized the ferryman well,
28 he cried out: "Make, make your knees bend.**Cornish:**
25 Vaghster nynsavsa nagra gweles ger, 26 pan wrug an gwynn gynsa dheuthughen war an arvor; 27 pan wrug ev anavos an gwayndor,
28 ev a leveris: "Gwra, gwra dhodh jyn glinow plegya."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
29 Ecco l’angel di Dio: piega le mani; 30 omai vedrai di sì fatti officiali.
31 Vedi che sdegna li argomenti umani, 32 sì che remo non vuol, né altro velo 33 che l’ali sue, tra liti sì lontani.
query.result:
**English:**
29 Behold the angel of God: fold your hands; 30 now you will see such officials.
31 See how he disdains human arguments, 32 so that he wants no oar, nor other sail 33 than his own wings, between such distant shores.**Cornish:**
29 Sel an el a Dhew: pleg dhodh dhewlyn; 30 mes a welo avel ofisoryon a'n par.
31 Gweles pan es ev owthava argumensow an dus, 32 marnas na vyn ev row, nag aral wel 33 mes y eskel dhe hwegen, ynter tirys mar bell.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Vedi come l’ha dritte verso ’l cielo, 35 trattando l’aere con l’etterne penne, 36 che non si mutan come mortal pelo».
query.result:
**English:**
34 See how he has them pointed straight towards heaven, 35 beating the air with his eternal wings, 36 which do not change like mortal hair.**Cornish:**
34 Gweles pan es ev ow th'oberi dheuth war an nef, 35 ow treylya an ayr gans y eskel byth, 36 na wra chanjya mar blew marow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 Poi, come più e più verso noi venne 38 l’uccel divino, più chiaro appariva: 39 per che l’occhio da presso nol sostenne,
40 ma chinail giuso; e quei sen venne a riva 41 con un vasello snelletto e leggero, 42 tanto che l’acqua nulla ne ’nghiottiva.
query.result:
**English:**
37 Then, as the divine bird came more and more towards us, 38 it appeared more clearly: 39 because my eye could not bear it from close up,
40 but I lowered it; and he came to the shore 41 with a swift and light vessel, 42 so much so that the water swallowed none of it.**Cornish:**
37 Wosa henna, mar moy ha moy dheuthughen dheugen 38 an edhen dhiwin, moy kler o sevel: 39 rag an lagha a-dho dhe bys na alla,
40 mes ev a omwhelas war-nans; ha henna a dheuth 41 gans lester prest ha golow, 42 marnas an dowr na alla nevra dhe bys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 Da poppa stava il celestial nocchiero, 44 tal che faria beato pur descripto; 45 e più di cento spirti entro sediero.
query.result:
**English:**
43 At the stern stood the celestial helmsman, 44 such that merely describing him would make one blessed; 45 and more than a hundred spirits sat inside.**Cornish:**
43 Yn pup a sevas an steryowr nevon, 44 marnas owth'oberi bethys byth vynten; 45 ha moy es pys spirys ow sedha a-benn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 ‘In exitu Isräel de Aegypto’ 47 cantavan tutti insieme ad una voce 48 con quanto di quel salmo è poscia scripto.
query.result:
**English:**
46 ‘When Israel went out of Egypt’ 47 they all sang together in one voice 48 with as much of that psalm as is written afterwards.**Cornish:**
46 ‘Yn termyn termyn Isräel a Ejyp’ 47 ow kanna oll owth'oberi yn unn lagas 48 gans kemmys a henna salm a veu skrifys wosa henna.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Poi fece il segno lor di santa croce; 50 ond’ ei si gittar tutti in su la piaggia: 51 ed el sen gì, come venne, veloce.
query.result:
**English:**
49 Then he made the sign of the holy cross for them; 50 whereupon they all threw themselves down on the shore: 51 and he departed, as he had come, swiftly.**Cornish:**
49 Wosa henna, ev a wrug an arwodh a'n groes dheughen; 50 wosa henna, oll a omwhlas war an traeth: 51 ha henna a omdhyskyn, mar a dheuth, yn bys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 La turba che rimase lì, selvaggia 53 parea del loco, rimirando intorno 54 come colui che nove cose assaggia.
query.result:
**English:**
52 The crowd that remained there, wild, 53 seemed out of place, looking around 54 like one who tastes new things.**Cornish:**
52 An bobel a veu owth'oberi, gwyls, 53 a sevellas marnas yn an le, ow treylya a-dro, 54 mar unn den a wra ow provia traow nowyth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 Da tutte parti saettava il giorno 56 lo sol, ch’avea con le saette conte 57 di mezzo ’l ciel cacciato Capricorno,
58 quando la nova gente alzò la fronte 59 ver’ noi, dicendo a noi: «Se voi sapete, 60 mostratene la via di gire al monte».
query.result:
**English:**
55 From every side the sun was shooting forth the day, 56 which, with its arrows, had driven Capricorn 57 from the middle of the sky,
58 when the new people raised their faces 59 towards us, saying to us: "If you know, 60 show us the way to go up the mountain".**Cornish:**
55 A-dro dhe bys an haul o sethas an jydh, 56 henna, gans y sel, a wrug Kaprikorn 57 a-dhyworth kres an nef ow th'yskynnya,
58 pan wrug an bobel nowydh ow sevel y fenester 59 dheugen, ow leverel dheugen: "Mar wyth a wydh, 60 diskwedh dheugen an fordh dhe'n menydh."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 E Virgilio rispuose: «Voi credete 62 forse che siamo esperti d’esto loco; 63 ma noi siam peregrin come voi siete.
query.result:
**English:**
61 And Virgil replied: "You perhaps believe 62 that we are experts in this place; 63 but we are pilgrims just like you."
**Cornish:**
61 Ha Virjili a rebegas: "Hwi a grys 62 mar nyns yw niver a-dro dhe'n le ma, 63 mes ny yw niver pererin avelowhwi."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 Dianzi venimmo, innanzi a voi un poco, 65 per altra via, che fu sì aspra e forte, 66 che lo salire omai ne parrà gioco».
query.result:
**English:**
64 We came here a short while ago, before you, 65 by another way, which was so rough and difficult, 66 that the climb up now will seem like child's play."
**Cornish:**
64 Nyns yw niver deuedhys, kyns dedhuchwi un tamm, 65 a-hys dhe fordh arall, o a veu kemmys kalet ha fethys, 66 bys dhe'n fordh dhe'n ughella bythkweth avel gwari."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 L’anime, che si fuor di me accorte, 68 per lo spirare, ch’i’ era ancor vivo, 69 maravigliando diventaro smorte.
query.result:
**English:**
67 The spirits, who had noticed that I was alive, 68 because of my breathing, 69 were amazed and turned pale.
**Cornish:**
67 An enevalow, a veu gweles ow byw, 68 dre'n eneval, ow kovsa byw, 69 a veu kevys ha troha pale.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 E come a messagger che porta ulivo 71 tragge la gente per udir novelle, 72 e di calcar nessun si mostra schivo,
73 così al viso mio s’affisar quelle 74 anime fortunate tutte quante, 75 quasi oblïando d’ire a farsi belle.
query.result:
**English:**
70 And like a messenger who brings an olive branch, 71 and draws people to hear the news, 72 and no one is reluctant to press forward,
73 so those fortunate spirits all fixed their gaze 74 on my face, 75 almost forgetting to go and make themselves beautiful.
**Cornish:**
70 Ha vel kevel a-dhorrhes olive, 71 a wra dhe dus dhe glywes nowethow, 72 ha neb a-dhismygi dhe'n fordh,
73 kevel dhe'm fas a veu dhe enevalow 74 oll an enevalow fortunys, 75 a-gas dhe'n fordh dhe wul dhe'n golonsi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Io vidi una di lor trarresi avante 77 per abbracciarmi con sì grande affetto, 78 che mosse me a far lo somigliante.
query.result:
**English:**
76 I saw one of them step forward 77 to embrace me with such great affection, 78 that it moved me to do the same.
**Cornish:**
76 Me a welas onen a-dheuth dhe'm ragdres 77 dhe'm golghi gans dhe'n kalon affection, 78 ow a veu ow movia dhe wul an keth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Ohi ombre vane, fuor che ne l’aspetto! 80 tre volte dietro a lei le mani avvinsi, 81 e tante mi tornai con esse al petto.
query.result:
**English:**
79 Oh, empty shades, except in appearance! 80 Three times I clasped my hands behind her, 81 and as many times they returned to my chest.
**Cornish:**
79 Oh, enevalow gwag, mes y'n aga! 80 Tri gweyth y'm golgas ow dhewol dhe'y golon, 81 ha tri gweyth y'm deuthas dhe'm golon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 Di maraviglia, credo, mi dipinsi; 83 per che l’ombra sorrise e si ritrasse, 84 e io, seguendo lei, oltre mi pinsi.
query.result:
**English:**
82 I think I turned pale with amazement; 83 because the shade smiled and drew back, 84 and I, following her, pressed on further.
**Cornish:**
82 Dre'm marvel, y'm grys, ow kovsa ow pinta; 83 rag an eneval a wra ow mosow ha ow thens, 84 ha my, ow sewya, ow kovsa ow mosow pella.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 Soavemente disse ch’io posasse; 86 allor conobbi chi era, e pregai 87 che, per parlarmi, un poco s’arrestasse.
query.result:
**English:**
85 She gently told me to sit down; 86 then I recognized who she was, and I begged her 87 to stop for a while so that she could speak to me.
**Cornish:**
85 Hi a leveris dhe'm ow posav; 86 ena y'm gwelas piw ow veu, ha my a wra ow pedas 87 dhe sevel tamm dhe leverel gansow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 Rispuosemi: «Così com’ io t’amai 89 nel mortal corpo, così t’amo sciolta: 90 però m’arresto; ma tu perché vai?».
query.result:
**English:**
88 She replied to me: "Just as I loved you 89 in your mortal body, so I love you now that you are free; 90 that is why I stop; but why are you going?"
**Cornish:**
88 Hi a leveris dhe'm: "Kepar ha'm ow karas 89 y'n korf mortal, keth ow karas dibarthys: 90 rag ena y'm sevel; mes tysa, perag ow mos?''

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 «Casella mio, per tornar altra volta 92 là dov’ io son, fo io questo vïaggio», 93 diss’ io; «ma a te com’ è tanta ora tolta?».
query.result:
**English:**
91 "Casella mine, I am making this journey 92 in order to return to the place where I am from," 93 I said; "but why have you been taken away for so long?"
**Cornish:**
91 "Casella ow, rag dhe dhyski dhe'n fordh arall 92 dhe'n le ma y'm deuth, ow kovsa ow viaj ma," 93 ow leveris; "mes dhys, perag ow kovsa ow kemeras dhe'n fordh ma rag kemmys termyn?''

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 Ond’ io, ch’era ora a la marina vòlto 101 dove l’acqua di Tevero s’insala, 102 benignamente fu’ da lui ricolto.
query.result:
**English:**
100 Whereupon I, who was now turned towards the shore 101 where the water of the Tiber becomes salty, 102 was kindly received by him.
**Cornish:**
100 Ha my, a veu lemmyn dhe'n fordh-ma troys, 101 le may Tevero a wra dhe wulsa, 102 yn dhyner o henna y'm beu kemerys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 A quella foce ha elli or dritta l’ala, 104 però che sempre quivi si ricoglie 105 qual verso Acheronte non si cala».
query.result:
**English:**
103 At that mouth he now spread his right wing, 104 because it is always there that he gathers 105 whoever does not descend towards Acheron.
**Cornish:**
103 Yn an fordh-ma na ytho henna lemmyn y esel dhe dhelergh, 104 rag hemma bys vyth ytho ytho kemerys 105 neb nyns yw mos dhe Acheron».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 E io: «Se nuova legge non ti toglie 107 memoria o uso a l’amoroso canto 108 che mi solea quetar tutte mie doglie,
109 di ciò ti piaccia consolare alquanto 110 l’anima mia, che, con la sua persona 111 venendo qui, è affannata tanto!».
query.result:
**English:**
106 And I: "If a new law does not take away from you 107 memory or practice of the loving song 108 that used to soothe all my sorrows,
109 may it please you to console with it somewhat 110 my soul, which, coming here with its body, 111 is so distressed!".
**Cornish:**
106 Ha my: "Mar nyns yw lagha nowydh ow tynna 107 kov niver po usadow dhe'n kan cher, 108 a veu usys dhe lowena oll ow dolgow,
109 ow henna owth owth plegya dhe lowena 110 ow enef, ow tos dhemmyn gans y gorf, 111 yw dhesempys kemmys!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 ‘Amor che ne la mente mi ragiona’ 113 cominciò elli allor sì dolcemente, 114 che la dolcezza ancor dentro mi suona.
query.result:
**English:**
112 "Love that discourses to me in my mind" 113 he began then so sweetly, 114 that the sweetness still resounds within me.
**Cornish:**
112 "Karanteth ow tos ow mynnicy owth leverel" 113 a dhallathas henna lemmyn kemmys dhyner, 114 bythkyn an dhyner a sowna byth owth colon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 Lo mio maestro e io e quella gente 116 ch’eran con lui parevan sì contenti, 117 come a nessun toccasse altro la mente.
query.result:
**English:**
115 My master and I and those people 116 who were with him seemed so content, 117 as if nothing else touched their minds.
**Cornish:**
115 Ow mester ha my ha'n dus ow thens 116 a veu gans henna kemmys lowen, 117 kepar dell ywth neb aral ow kovsa y'gan menow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Noi eravam tutti fissi e attenti 119 a le sue note; ed ecco il veglio onesto 120 gridando: «Che è ciò, spiriti lenti?
121 qual negligenza, quale stare è questo? 122 Correte al monte a spogliarvi lo scoglio 123 ch’esser non lascia a voi Dio manifesto».
query.result:
**English:**
118 We were all fixed and attentive 119 to his notes; and behold the venerable old man 120 crying out: "What is this, slow spirits?
121 What negligence, what idleness is this? 122 Run to the mountain to strip yourselves of the rock 123 that does not allow God to be manifest to you".
**Cornish:**
118 Ni o oll fisys ha prederys 119 dhe'y notys; ha wetho'n hen dhegwir 120 ow leverel: "Pyth yw henna, spyrys lent?
121 Pyth esneges, pyth sevel yw henna? 122 Redya dhe'n menydh dhe spolya an garrek 123 na wra dalleth dheuch Duw dhe vos kler."
